title: Dow Jones Stocks To Buy And Watch For June 2020 In Coronavirus Stock Market Rally
summary:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average continued to rally sharply in May, as the stock market snapped back from the coronavirus crash.
Top Dow Jones stocks to watch in June are Apple (AAPL), Intel (INTC), Microsoft (MSFT), Visa (V) and Walmart (WMT).
There are 30 Dow Jones stocks designed to serve as a bellwether for the general U.S. stock market.
Potential Dow Jones stocks to buy and watch in June that are in or near buy zones include Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Visa and Walmart.

text:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average continued to rally sharply in May, as the stock market snapped back from the coronavirus crash. Top Dow Jones stocks to watch in June are Apple (AAPL), Intel (INTC), Microsoft (MSFT), Visa (V) and Walmart (WMT).

X

There are clear winners — and losers — through the first five months of 2020. The top three performing Dow Jones stocks year-to-date were Microsoft, Home Depot (HD) and Apple with gains of 16.2%, 13.8% and 8.3%, respectively.

The three biggest losers through May were Boeing (BA), Exxon Mobil (XOM) and JP Morgan (JPM) with declines of 55.2%, 34.8% and 30.2%, respectively.

In 2020, the Dow Jones industrials slid more than 34% through the March 23 close. The tech-heavy Nasdaq composite fell 23.5%, while the S&P 500 declined 30.7% through the March 23 close. After sharply rallying, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 11.1% in 2020. The S&P 500 is still down 5.8%, while the Nasdaq is up 5.8% through the May 29 close.

What Is The Dow Jones Industrial Average?

Founded in 1896 with 12 stocks, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is one of the oldest stock market indexes. There are 30 Dow Jones stocks designed to serve as a bellwether for the general U.S. stock market. Other major stock indexes include the technology-heavy Nasdaq composite and the S&P 500 index — an index of the 500 largest companies in the United States.

Dow Jones Stocks To Watch

Amid the current coronavirus stock market uptrend— according to the IBD Big Picture — investors should be focusing on the stocks that are setting up and breaking out. These stocks will have strong relative strength lines, and could be some of the new uptrend's stock market leaders.

Potential Dow Jones stocks to buy and watch in June that are in or near buy zones include Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Visa and Walmart.

Coronavirus Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The New Uptrend

Apple Stock

Dow Jones stock leader Apple is just above a new buy point at 319.79. The new breakout gives investors the opportunity to add to an existing position. Shares moved up 0.5% Tuesday.

Apple stock broke out on April 30 past a cup with handle's 288.35 buy point, according to MarketSmith chart analysis and is out of the 5% buy range.

Late April 30, Apple reported strong quarterly results. The stock's relative strength line is at new highs, a bullish signal. The RS line measures a stock's price performance vs. the general market.

According to the IBD Stock Checkup, Apple stock has a 91 out of a highest-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating, placing it in the upper tier of growth stocks. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.

Intel Stock

Chip leader Intel broke out above a new buy point in a cup with handle on May 20. The formation shows a new entry at 62.23. The 5% buy zone runs up to 65.34. Intel shares moved up 0.4% Tuesday and are right below the entry.

Per the IBD Stock Checkup, Intel stock has a best-possible 99 IBD Composite Rating, placing it in the top echelon of growth stocks. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.

Microsoft Stock

Dow Jones stock leader Microsoft is in buy range past a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point. Shares advanced 1.1% Tuesday.

Shares also broke out on April 16 above a 175.10 correct buy point in a double bottom, according to MarketSmith chart analysis.

Microsoft is an IBD Leaderboard stock idea and an IBD Long-Term Leader.

Bullishly, the RS line hit a new high in recent weeks, indicating strong relative performance.

Visa Stock

Visa stock is trading just above the top of the 5% buy zone above a cup-with-handle's 185.85 buy point after a breakout on May 18. The 5% buy range runs up to 195.14. Shares rallied 1% Tuesday to move out of the buy zone.

On April 30, Visa reported strong fiscal-Q2 results. Visa earnings climbed to $1.39 a share with revenue climbing to $5.90 billion.

Walmart Stock

Dow Jones stock leader Walmart is tracing a flat base with a 133.48 buy point. Shares are trading at their 50-day moving average line. Shares edged lower Tuesday.

A potential weakness is the stock's lagging RS line. In mid March, the stock's RS line spiked to new highs as the stock sharply outperformed during the coronavirus stock market crash.

Tip: Before making any investment decisions, be sure to check current market conditions, and use IBD Stock Checkup to see if your stock gets passing ratings for the most important fundamental and technical criteria. To get ongoing chart analysis, and alerts to buy and sell signals, check out the unique features, stock lists and chart annotations at MarketSmith, Leaderboard and SwingTrader.

Be sure to follow Scott Lehtonen on Twitter at @IBD_SLehtonen for more on growth stocks and the stock market.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/research/" rel="category tag">Research</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
Dow Jones Stocks To Buy And Watch In June 2020: Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Visa, Walmart	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/research/dow-jones-stocks/" data-a2a-title="Dow Jones Stocks To Buy And Watch In June 2020: Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Visa, Walmart"><a class="a2a_button_facebook" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/facebook?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fresearch%2Fdow-jones-stocks%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Stocks%20To%20Buy%20And%20Watch%20In%20June%202020%3A%20Apple%2C%20Intel%2C%20Microsoft%2C%20Visa%2C%20Walmart" title="Facebook" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/facebook.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Facebook"></a><a class="a2a_button_twitter" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/twitter?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fresearch%2Fdow-jones-stocks%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Stocks%20To%20Buy%20And%20Watch%20In%20June%202020%3A%20Apple%2C%20Intel%2C%20Microsoft%2C%20Visa%2C%20Walmart" title="Twitter" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/twitter.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Twitter"></a><a class="a2a_button_linkedin" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/linkedin?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fresearch%2Fdow-jones-stocks%2F&linkname=Dow%20Jones%20Stocks%20To%20Buy%20And%20Watch%20In%20June%202020%3A%20Apple%2C%20Intel%2C%20Microsoft%2C%20Visa%2C%20Walmart" title="LinkedIn" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/linkedin.png" width="25" height="25" alt="LinkedIn"></a><a class="a2a_dd addtoany_share_save addtoany_share" href="https://www.addtoany.com/share"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/email.png" alt="Share"></a></div> <a class="reprints-button sharing" href="https://www.ibdlicensing.com" target="_blank">Licensing</a>
</div>
<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/lehtonens/" title="Posts by SCOTT LEHTONEN" class="author url fn" rel="author">SCOTT LEHTONEN</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">04:25 PM ET 06/02/2020</li>
</ul>

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>The <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/dow-jones-today-dow-stocks-stock-market-news/">Dow Jones Industrial Average</a> continued to rally sharply in May, as the stock market snapped back from the coronavirus crash. Top Dow Jones stocks to watch in June are <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>), <strong>Intel</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=INTC' target='_blank'>INTC</a>), <strong>Microsoft</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=MSFT' target='_blank'>MSFT</a>), <strong>Visa</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=V' target='_blank'>V</a>) and <strong>Walmart</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=WMT' target='_blank'>WMT</a>).</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="3883641" vid-dom-id="3883641-5ed709972d9dd" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/VfhbckgW.m3u8" data-captions="[{"name":"English","url":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/tracks\/9puBFzBI.vtt"}]" vid-name="How To Buy Stocks: Psychology Of Chart Patterns" vid-cat="How To Invest" vid-date="04/01/2019" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Screen-Shot-2018-11-02-at-3.27.43-PM-640x360.png" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-3883641-5ed709972d9dd" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"How To Buy Stocks: Psychology Of Chart Patterns","description":"Savvy investors not only know how to spot the most profitable chart patterns that launch big price runs, but they're also keenly aware of the psychology behind them. That's helpful in understanding how and why virtually all major stock moves begin after a new chart pattern forms.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/Screen-Shot-2018-11-02-at-3.27.43-PM-640x360.png","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/VfhbckgW.m3u8","uploadDate":"2019-04-01T15:09:00+0000","duration":"PT252.25S","author":"ALISSA CORAM","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/06\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>There are clear winners — and losers — through the first five months of 2020. The top three performing Dow Jones stocks year-to-date were Microsoft, <strong>Home Depot</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=HD' target='_blank'>HD</a>) and Apple with gains of 16.2%, 13.8% and 8.3%, respectively.</p>
<p>The three biggest losers through May were <strong>Boeing</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=BA' target='_blank'>BA</a>), <strong>Exxon</strong> <strong>Mobil</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=XOM' target='_blank'>XOM</a>) and <strong>JP Morgan</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=JPM' target='_blank'>JPM</a>) with declines of 55.2%, 34.8% and 30.2%, respectively.</p>
<p>In 2020, the Dow Jones industrials slid more than 34% through the March 23 close. The tech-heavy Nasdaq composite fell 23.5%, while the S&P 500 declined 30.7% through the March 23 close. After sharply rallying, the Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 11.1% in 2020. The S&P 500 is still down 5.8%, while the Nasdaq is up 5.8% through the May 29 close.</p>

<h2>What Is The Dow Jones Industrial Average?</h2>
<p>Founded in 1896 with 12 stocks, the <a href="https://www.investors.com/etfs-and-funds/personal-finance/what-is-the-dow-jones-industrial-average/">Dow Jones Industrial Average</a> is one of the oldest stock market indexes. There are 30 Dow Jones stocks designed to serve as a bellwether for the general U.S. stock market. Other major stock indexes include the technology-heavy Nasdaq composite and the S&P 500 index — an index of the 500 largest companies in the United States.</p>
<h2>Dow Jones Stocks To Watch</h2>
<p>Amid the current coronavirus stock market uptrend— according to the <a href="https://www.investors.com/category/market-trend/the-big-picture/">IBD Big Picture</a> — investors should be focusing on the stocks that are setting up and breaking out. These stocks will have <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/a-stock-breakout-specialty-tool-the-relative-strength-line/">strong relative strength lines</a>, and could be some of the new uptrend's stock market leaders.</p>
<p>Potential Dow Jones stocks to buy and watch in June that are in or near buy zones include Apple, Intel, Microsoft, Visa and Walmart.</p>
<hr />
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/ibds-etf-market-strategy/ibds-etf-market-strategy/"><strong>Coronavirus Stock Market ETF Strategy And How To Invest In The New Uptrend</strong></a></p>
<hr />
<h2>Apple Stock</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=AAPL'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Dow Jones stock leader Apple is just above a new buy point at 319.79. The new breakout gives investors the opportunity to add to an existing position. Shares moved up 0.5% Tuesday.</p>
<p>Apple stock broke out on April 30 past a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup with handle's</a> 288.35 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a>, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith chart analysis</a> and is out of the 5% buy range.</p>
<p>Late April 30, Apple reported <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/click/apple-stock-stays-buy-zone-coronavirus-quarterly-report/">strong quarterly results</a>. The stock's <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/a-stock-breakout-specialty-tool-the-relative-strength-line/">relative strength line</a> is at new highs, a bullish signal. The RS line measures a stock's price performance vs. the general market.</p>
<p>According to the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/">IBD Stock Checkup</a>, <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-apple-inc-aapl.aspx">Apple stock</a> has a 91 out of a highest-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>, placing it in the upper tier of growth stocks. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.</p>
<h2>Intel Stock</h2>
<p>Chip leader Intel broke out above a new <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a> in a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-buy-stocks-cup-with-handle-base-alibaba-stock-buy-point/">cup with handle</a> on May 20. The formation shows a new entry at 62.23. <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/nvidia-buy-range/">The 5% buy zone</a> runs up to 65.34. Intel shares moved up 0.4% Tuesday and are right below the entry.</p>
<p>Per the <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/">IBD Stock Checkup</a>, <a href="https://research.investors.com/stock-checkup/nasdaq-intel-corp-intc.aspx">Intel stock</a> has a best-possible 99 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/how-to-research-growth-stocks/">IBD Composite Rating</a>, placing it in the top echelon of growth stocks. The Composite Rating is a blend of key fundamental and technical metrics to help investors easily gauge a stock's strengths.</p>
<h2>Microsoft Stock</h2>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=MSFT'></iframe></div></div>
<p>Dow Jones stock leader Microsoft is in buy range past a cup-with-handle's 180.10 buy point. Shares advanced 1.1% Tuesday.</p>
<p>Shares also broke out on April 16 above a 175.10 correct buy point in a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/what-is-double-bottom-base-biotech-stocks/">double bottom</a>, according to <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/marketsmith/?artProdLink=MarketSmith">MarketSmith</a> chart analysis.</p>
<p>Microsoft is an <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD Leaderboard</a> stock idea and an <a href="https://www.investors.com/research/ibd-long-term-leaders-screen/">IBD Long-Term Leader</a>.</p>
<p>Bullishly, the RS line hit a new high in recent weeks, indicating strong relative performance.</p>
<div class="small-12 columns medium-6 leftchart"><div class='ibd-chart-container' style='position:relative;width:100%;height:462px;overflow:hidden;'><iframe class='ibd-chart-frame' style='position:absolute;top:0;left:0;width:99.9%;height:100%;' frameborder='0' src='https://research.investors.com/ibdchartswp.aspx?cht=pvc&type=daily&symbol=V'></iframe></div></div>
<h2>Visa Stock</h2>
<p>Visa stock is trading just above the top of the 5% buy zone above a cup-with-handle's 185.85 buy point after a breakout on May 18. The 5% buy range runs up to 195.14. Shares rallied 1% Tuesday to move out of the buy zone.</p>
<p>On April 30, Visa reported <a href="https://www.investors.com/news/mastercard-earnings-q1-2020-visa-earnings-q2-2020/">strong fiscal-Q2 results</a>. Visa earnings climbed to $1.39 a share with revenue climbing to $5.90 billion.</p>
<h2>Walmart Stock</h2>
<p>Dow Jones stock leader Walmart is tracing a <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/when-to-buy-the-basics-of-a-flat-base-a-super-growth-stock-pattern/">flat base</a> with a 133.48 <a href="https://www.investors.com/how-to-invest/investors-corner/chart-reading-basics-how-a-buy-point-marks-a-time-of-opportunity/">buy point</a>. Shares are trading at their 50-day moving average line. Shares edged lower Tuesday.</p>
<p>A potential weakness is the stock's lagging RS line. In mid March, the stock's RS line spiked to new highs as the stock sharply outperformed during the coronavirus stock market crash.</p>
